member.name: T:Amazon.ServerMigrationService.Model.CreateReplicationJobRequest
member.summary: Container for the parameters to the CreateReplicationJob operation. Creates a replication job. The replication job schedules periodic replication runs to replicate your server to AWS. Each replication run creates an Amazon Machine Image (AMI).

member.summary:

member.summary:
Gets and sets the property Frequency.
The time between consecutive replication runs, in hours.

member.name: P:Amazon.ServerMigrationService.Model.CreateReplicationJobRequest.KmsKeyId
member.summary:
Gets and sets the property KmsKeyId.
The ID of the KMS key for replication jobs that produce encrypted AMIs. This value can be any of the following:
KMS key ID
KMS key alias
ARN referring to the KMS key ID
ARN referring to the KMS key alias
If encrypted is true but a KMS key ID is not specified, the customer's default KMS key for Amazon EBS is used.

member.name: P:Amazon.ServerMigrationService.Model.CreateReplicationJobRequest.LicenseType
member.summary:

The license type to be used for the AMI created by a successful replication run.

member.summary:

member.name: P:Amazon.ServerMigrationService.Model.ImportAppCatalogRequest.RoleName
member.summary:

member.name: T:Amazon.ServerMigrationService.Model.ImportServerCatalogRequest
member.summary:
Container for the parameters to the ImportServerCatalog operation. Gathers a complete list of on-premises servers. Connectors must be installed and monitoring all servers to import.
This call returns immediately, but might take additional time to retrieve all the servers.

member.name: T:Amazon.ServerMigrationService.AmazonServerMigrationServiceClient
member.summary:
Implementation for accessing ServerMigrationService
AWS Server Migration Service
AWS Server Migration Service (AWS SMS) makes it easier and faster for you to migrate your on-premises workloads to AWS. To learn more about AWS SMS, see the following resources:
AWS Server Migration Service product page
AWS Server Migration Service User Guide

member.name: M:Amazon.ServerMigrationService.AmazonServerMigrationServiceClient.#ctor
member.summary:
Constructs AmazonServerMigrationServiceClient with the credentials loaded from the application's default configuration, and if unsuccessful from the Instance Profile service on an EC2 instance.
Example App.config with credentials set.
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8" ?> <configuration> <appSettings> <add key="AWSProfileName" value="AWS Default"/> </appSettings> </configuration>

member.summary:
Starts an on-demand replication run for the specified replication job. This replication run starts immediately. This replication run is in addition to the ones already scheduled.
There is a limit on the number of on-demand replications runs that you can request in a 24-hour period.

member.name: T:Amazon.ServerMigrationService.IAmazonServerMigrationService
member.summary:
Interface for accessing ServerMigrationService
AWS Server Migration Service
AWS Server Migration Service (AWS SMS) makes it easier and faster for you to migrate your on-premises workloads to AWS. To learn more about AWS SMS, see the following resources:
AWS Server Migration Service product page
AWS Server Migration Service User Guide

member.name: M:Amazon.ServerMigrationService.IAmazonServerMigrationService.StartOnDemandReplicationRun(Amazon.ServerMigrationService.Model.StartOnDemandReplicationRunRequest)
member.summary:
Starts an on-demand replication run for the specified replication job. This replication run starts immediately. This replication run is in addition to the ones already scheduled.
There is a limit on the number of on-demand replications runs that you can request in a 24-hour period.
member.param: Container for the necessary parameters to execute the StartOnDemandReplicationRun service method.
member.returns: The response from the StartOnDemandReplicationRun service method, as returned by ServerMigrationService.
member.exception: The user has the required permissions, so the request would have succeeded, but a dry run was performed.
A specified parameter is not valid.
You have exceeded the number of on-demand replication runs you can request in a 24-hour period.
You lack permissions needed to perform this operation. Check your IAM policies, and ensure that you are using the correct access keys.
member.seealso: REST API Reference for StartOnDemandReplicationRun Operation
